intro: Lacis dicraea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and dense, branching structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with low rainfall. The wood of Lacis dicraea is hard and durable, making it valuable for traditional and local uses.
